description: Spanning two centuries, from the founding of the colonies to the close of the Civil War, this
course begins the discussion of questions central to the entire sequence: "What is an American?"
"What does it mean to be free?" Students explore the institutions, images, and stories of
Euro-Americans, African Americans, and Native Americans.Topics and texts range from the
Declaration of Independence and Thomas Jefferson's architecture to the Narrative of
the Life of Frederick Douglass and the coming of the Civil War. Offered annually in the
fall semester. Counts towards American studies major.
